required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind Phase III Clinical Trial to Assess and Compare to the Efficacy and Safety of Lafutidine, Famotidine and Omeprazole-referenced in Korean Erosive Esophagitis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind Phase III Clinical Trial to Assess and Compare to the Efficacy and Safety of Lafutidine, Famotidine and Omeprazole-referenced in Koran Erosive Esophagitis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the healing rate and safety of Lafutidine in erosive esophagitis

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Recovery rates of reflux esophagitis on the Esophago Gastro Duodenoscopy test after 8 week treatment-FAS

secondary_outcome.measure: The Proportion of Days Without 'Cardinal Symptom'
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of days without 'Cardinal symptom' after 4 or 8 week treatment-FAS 'Cardinal symptom': Burning sesation in the chest, Acid reflux, Heartburn including chest pain

secondary_outcome.measure: The Proportion of Daytimes Without 'Cardinal Symptom'
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of daytimes without 'Cardinal symptom' after 4 or 8 week treatment-FAS 'Cardinal symptom': Burning sensation in the chest, Acid reflux, Heartburn including chest pain

secondary_outcome.measure: The Proportion of Nighttimes Without 'Cardinal Symptom'
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of Nighttimes without 'Cardinal symptom' after 4 or 8 treatment-FAS 'Cardinal symptom': Burning sensation in the chest, Acid reflux, Heartburn including chest pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who had symptoms of heartburn with a diagnosis of grade A to D reflux esophagitis according to the Los Angeles classification
Exclusion Criteria:
- Gastric or duodenal ulcers (excluding ulcer scars)
- Concurrent presence of Barrett's esophagus
- A history of a poor response to H2RA or PPI given in the recommended dose for 8 weeks
- Other conditions considered by the attending physician to potentially affect the assessment of efficacy and safety

baseline.population: Because of a Duplicated subject in Active comparator, One was excluded.

outcome.title: Recovery Rates of Reflux Esophagitis
outcome.description: Recovery rates of reflux esophagitis on the Esophago Gastro Duodenoscopy test after 8 week treatment-FAS

measure.title: Recovery Rates of Reflux Esophagitis
measure.description: Recovery rates of reflux esophagitis on the Esophago Gastro Duodenoscopy test after 8 week treatment-FAS

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority: The Lower limit is not lower than -15%

event.description: He had musculoskeletal pain because of a car accident, during the treatment period. The physician confirmed that this shoulder pain was caused by muscle tears, which he originally had, and judged that causality of this event with IP was unlikely.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.description: During the treatment period, he got biopsy at the Dermatology for skin lesion on the left inguinal area, which he had 2 years ago. The result was basal cell carcinoma, but the physician judged that causality of this event with the IP was unlikely.
Pregnancy After 1 month of the treatment peroid, she dropped out of the trial. About 7 months later, she gave birth to a healthy baby boy.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
